website_summaries.verdict: A solid axe with extra handle length that works well for taller users.
pros: Handle design helps maintain a firm grip
Longer handle and heavier head weight give it more power per strike
cons: May be too heavy and long for small users

customer_reviews.title: Move along to Home Depot, they will stand by their products
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars provides lifetime warranties without registration for all of their tools except this one... Hmmm. Did they knew it was a lousy splitting ex? It chipped on first day of use also injuring my boyfriend with the flying piece, the blade became dull fairly quickly (however, we had a very large cedar to get through), and it's pretty much useless to us now and we're out $50 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing warranty
customer_reviews.text: The axe worked well, until it broke from normal use. I reached out to Fiskars for warranty support on their so called lifetime warranty and all they told me was to send in the broken handle and they would send me a new axe. The problem with that is sending them the broken handle will cost about the same as a new axe... So buyer beware of this warranty, it’s pretty pointless. They didn’t even offer to send me a prepaid label or anything like that. I was fairy disappointed. Also, the edge chipped pretty easy on the axe head.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: maybe its me, maybe it aint
customer_reviews.text: I used it 1 time, the plastic split at the head and sent a 3 pound ax head flying. I got it on black Friday, and used it a couple of days ago, splitting wood, - well the intent was split wood. But that handle split like a banana. If I would have paid full price for it I would have been royally PO'd, but since it was 67% off I am 67% PO'd about it. I gave it 5 stars on weight distro, this is before and after the head went sailing. its light AF without the head. With the head I was excited for a sharp splitting ax. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Westley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Axe
customer_reviews.text: I know I have reviewed this before, its just every time I use this Axe I like it more and more, anyway to I did a quickie unedited video of me splitting a few rounds, I have split Doug Fur, Aspen, Walnut and Hickory, some rounds take several hits, and is still 1/2 the work of using wedges and mauls...
customer_reviews.author: RodneyLee

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Big gash on the handle. Don't have time to return as I leave town in the morning for a work trip. I'm not an engineer but I'm pretty sure that a gash in the handle will greatly affect its safety.
customer_reviews.author: nophonevalet

customer_reviews.title: Dullest ax I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Worst POS I have ever bought. Would not even bite into wood. My 10 year old ax works 10 times better than this. Don’t waste your money???? Would not even split very dry small logs. Would go in maybe 1/8 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Erehwon

customer_reviews.title: For some logs it works better than a splitting maul
customer_reviews.text: 3 friends who've tried mine, decide to buy their own. It's not "magic". For some logs it works better than a splitting maul. Often I'll go back to the maul. This is less effort to swing than an 8 pound maul. If it isn't enough power to blast through with one stroke, the axe does not seem to do much toward a second (or third) strike split. I think it is better suited to dry wood or smaller rounds. Most of my wood splitting is done on 20" rounds that were live trees within the previous few days. This has MUCH more power than a simple hatchet, but less momentum than a maul.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Blade

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately.
customer_reviews.text: This broke the first time I used it, after splitting logs for less than 2 hours. I put the "virtually" in their "virtually indestructible" claim. I filed a warranty claim and Fiskars said it would be 15-20 business days before they responded. It's now more than 20 days and I have not gotten a reply to my claim. Terrible product. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Werner

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 5 months, then axe head split from shaft. Emailed fiskars and they said they would only process the claim after i sent the axe handle back and i have to pay return shipping. So when it breaks just remember you have to buy the axe, then spend probably half the money to buy a new one mailing a 3 foot handle back, just to get it replaced
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Axe head broke off!
customer_reviews.text: About the 4th log I started splitting, the axe handle broke right up by the axe head. I was fortunate that the head didn't go flying. Trying to determine how to return it since the item page says it has a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective tool, satisfying to use
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I don't have a lot of experience with splitting axes. I do have some large logs of eucalyptus and Casuarina ironwood that I had tried to split with a smaller axe, unsuccessfully. When I took this splitting axe to them, I was able to reduce logs that were 3 feet in diameter to chunks of the right size to be usable in a fireplace. Considering the hardness of the wood and how eucalyptus is cross-grained, I am very happy with the tool. Obviously it's hard work and it takes some practice to swing the axe down hard, precisely and safely.
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Dona

customer_reviews.title: Love that the handle isn't wood!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom. She didn't want a wooden handle because she always breaks them. She wanted a solid metal axe that was all one piece. I found this and thought since it was lighter it would be easier for her to use but was nervous since it had a "handle". She loves it!! She says it's actually easier to use than the solid metal axes and it feels sturdy and well made. She has used it several times now and has not broke it which says a lot for my mom, so I'm confident this axe is great if your looking for an axe that can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Dollskin16

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: I had the X25 prior to purchasing this and this axe is admittedly much more axe to handle. I had been using the shorter axe for years so it took me some time to get my aim dialed in again. Now that I have I really love this tool. It's done a great job of getting through very large, very fresh Doug Fir rounds in quick order. I have split about a cord so far and the blade remains very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: PNWRich

customer_reviews.title: This is a great axe, split up 5 large pieces of firewood in about one minute
customer_reviews.text: This axe worked great for me splitting up some larger pieces of firewood. I'm 60, and I didn't even have to swing the axe real hard at all, and the axe went through the firewood real quick turning it into kindling. I split up five large chunks of firewood in about one minute, no exaggeration at all. The picture just shows the kindling from two pieces of firewood. It went so smooth I then split a few more. Didn't even work up much of a sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: dull
customer_reviews.text: this aze is super dull and I don't think it is meant to split ordinary wood. Maybe you can split a huge block with one or two strikes but you can't split you everyday firewood with it :(
customer_reviews.author: Rene Netter

customer_reviews.title: Great axe - worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I live on a forested 10 acres and occasionally harvest blow down trees for stove fuel. I normally use a mall and regular axe to break up the bucked wood but purchased this Fiskars splitting axe due to the good reviews. I just split about 1 1/2 cords of Maple and was amazed at how often a single blow would split a 12 - 14 inch round. I rarely write reviews but will get in line with others lauding this splitting axe.
customer_reviews.author: John Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wood splitting tool!!
customer_reviews.text: This splitting axe is literally night and day, i can not explain to you have much that i have used mine. I have two by the way, the home i used to live in for 3 years i used it every single day nearly splitting wood as much as i could alongside with my cousin. I wish i had known about this back when i was younger as my grandfather always split wood with a maul and a wedge sometimes. I split an ungodly amount of firewood with this and it still goes strong. I'd advise finding something to help sharpen with it as it'll lose it's edge fairly quick but.i just used a file.
customer_reviews.author: Audio_Freak

customer_reviews.title: Splitting Axe
customer_reviews.text: So, this is designed just - exactly - right for splitting wood. I have lots of popular, maple and oak - and after I dried it for 4-5 months, this split it down with no problems. The head is moderately heavy with a fine tip, coated head, that quickly expands to split and help prevent the head from burying itself in wood and becoming a real chore to pull from the wood. Works better then any other I have ever purchased, and I normally split about 2-3 cords of wood every year for the last 10 years. Hopefully this axe will survive at least 3 seasons - if so, it will be well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ForrestA

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: This axe is not cheap. It is super sharp and moves easy in the hands. It did a great job of splitting, however the handle literally snapped clean off at the head after 3 uses with maybe 1/2 a cord of wood total split. Was great to be at our camp, that is fly in only in South East Alaska, with a brand new, expensive and broken axe. Bought a much cheaper on on here that has split over 6 cords of wood and looks great. And before you blame user error there were no bad chops, I wouldn't rate it negatively if it had been my fault.
customer_reviews.author: eric Leusch

customer_reviews.title: Weak product
customer_reviews.text: Very weak. Broke after the first day. Might be ok for very small pieces though
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: For SPLITTING wood, not chopping down trees, not chopping up an entire log, but wood that has already been cut but needs split? THIS Is the tool to have. For the money, top quality, well made, nice simple locking feature for safe transport. Bought a Husky axe with wood handle, broke it in a week. Yes you can buy better for hundreds, even a $1,000.00 but for splitting even the most stubborn wood, great item!
customer_reviews.author: MSMisBS

customer_reviews.title: Okay for smaller logs...
customer_reviews.text: Just back from splitting a pile of Doug fir, comparing side-by-side with my American maul. The Fiskars seems to work well for logs about 10" and smaller, but when splitting 12"-20" logs, the old standby shines, simply because it's got the mass to power through a stringy log. I've also got a stack of maple, oak and cherry that I haven't tried the Swedish marvel on. I'll report back if anyone's interested. As a bit of information, my old standby maul (8 lb.) is kept sharp and polished--a lot of grief is caused by those who don't take care of their tools--and I suspect that the Fiskars splitting ax is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck(G)

customer_reviews.title: Must buy and quicker than a splitter
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best splitting axe I have ever used. Shipping was two days late per advertised delivery date with prime but will not complain it was free shipping and splitting axe is amazing way better than my old trooper maul. Could not find this model local anywhere why ordered online and glad I did. Super light does not wear you out recommend the longer handle especially if split on ground. Accidentally missed few times that will happen after doing wood all day lol can say handle is very durable and easy to hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built, strong, and effective
customer_reviews.text: Great Maul! Bought this to get away from using a sledge and a diamond wedge, plus now I have both. If you've never used one before, it takes a little time to get used to the weight and swinging power, plus you need to know where you're hitting, aka learn to aim. Some people I know have horrible aim or control over their swings. Handle is lightweight, yet strong, and the overall weight is perfect for my build. I bought the longer 36in because you never know who will be helping to split wood! Recommended. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: The Bear

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of old axes, and wood splitters, like the kind with grey wood handles and rusty blades. I finally bit the bullet and bought myself a new wood splitter. It's amazing. I can now split as much wood at the same rate as my brother with a gas powered wood splitter. Most logs split with one swing, the tougher ones require a few swings. It's great exercise, easy to use, and effective. I just wish I had bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Walking Onion

customer_reviews.title: overpriced... get a cheap one locally
customer_reviews.text: I'm still swinging my cheap go devil from the local tractor supply store and this $$$ sits idle in the barn
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This axe is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up chopping and splitting wood with a heavy double bit axe in Utah and Virginia so I had my fingers crossed when purchasing this axe. I was skeptical about a plastic handle and lighter head but after the first chop I was astonished. It went through a 16 inch log like it wasn’t even there. It handles knots well, too. I would recommend some practice swings for those not used to the length to get your aim right. Also, make sure no one is standing next to you because this thing launches the wood a ways. You want an axe that makes you look like you know what you’re doing? Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: J Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Solid Axe
customer_reviews.text: Had this seven years strong and no issues. Had it sharpened several times without a problem. Weight is distributed well and it has some good heft. Solid all the way around and doesn't feel like it'll break after some long splitting. The head is solid and makes your feel confident. Work on your swing and you'll split like a champ. Takes a lot of practice and technique but this axe can help you get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Wombat

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best axe I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a few different applications, with the most frequent being log splitting. It has great ergonomics and weight distribution and was even super helpful out on the trail for clearing some obstacles in a pinch. I've hit the handle right under the head a few times by mistake and the composite material soaked the shock up wonderfully! Highly suggested buy in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Noticably better than my old maul
customer_reviews.text: For the past month, COVID-19 has kept me confined to the home...no better time to finally attack that pile of wood that needed to be split for campfire wood. I'm 55, an hour a day of splitting and this splitting axe has made it easy to keep at it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Langdon

customer_reviews.title: Best. Axe. EVAH!
customer_reviews.text: I have a much heavier Fiskars maul, which is absolutely fantastic. So after Harbor Freight axe broke, I decided to get myself a proper splitting axe. As soon as I got it, I was excited to try it, after reading all these reviews. Oh yeah, it is the best dang axe I ever owned or tried. So easy to aim, so easy to control, and it does a superb job splitting wood. I would say I am about twice as fast with it, compared to the cheapo axe.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo S

customer_reviews.title: Speed is the key
customer_reviews.text: I've been splitting wood with mauls, sledges and wedges since I was a kid. I always believed heavier was better (I have a 25 lb splitting maul). Speed, lack of drag once in the wood and the angle of the wedge head are key. This thing carves through Cherry like nothing. I've had to throttle back my swing to 40% power. I can split all day with this - great design!
customer_reviews.author: analog kid

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Efficient Design
customer_reviews.text: I split a lot of wood; spruce, birch and cottonwood, mostly. This axe beats my old 4 lb splitting maul all hollow. I can swing it almost effortlessly and except on the widest pieces it splits with a resounding whack with one blow. The ingenious wedge design acts almost like a splitting wedge, yet releases with minimal pressure when a split isn't achieved initially. I now own four Fiskars from the hatchet to this and to say I am both pleased and impressed is putting it mildly. All of my old collection of axes and hatchets have been retired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome axe but not for the hard to split wood
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my 10 & 12 year old sons wanted to split wood. We have a wood cook stove in the kitchen my wife likes to cook with during the winter and requires smaller wood so this works great for that. I have used it and go back to my 8 lb. maul for the big pieces of wood. This works great for wood that splits easier but I have an outdoor wood stove that I just burn the hard to split pieces. Thinking of also getting the shorter handle axe or hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Makes hard work easy.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this axe a test splitting dry white oak with knots and forks. The axe splits through it all, most of the time with just one try. Some of the tougher pieces may take 3 tries. I usually always split white oak with my hydraulic splitter because it’s hard to split but now I can use this axe as well to save time. I really like that it is lightweight so it doesn’t wear me out. Great product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer6415

customer_reviews.title: The splits!!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp blade with a medium to steep taper and works great on 12" to 26" rounds I split. Blunt wedges and blunt splinting axes just don't work on the already down Ponderosa Pine and Doug Fir I cut. I have a tendency to get inpatient and rap the axe with a maul occasionally (and they are tough) but I do get a new one about every 3 years. The cost is worth it and I have not found a better splitting maul. I am 71, have been doing this for many years, and only hand split about 10 to 12 cords a year but this for me is a must have well balanced axe.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for wood splitting
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these to take camping to split wood. This little guy is AMAZING! it takes little effort to split wood. Just about every hit is a winner. I liked it so much I bought one for my sister in law who splits her own wood. She loves hers just as much as I love mine. It will even split wood with knots. Not even my trusty axe can get through some of those knots. Great product. Lifetime warranty. Good enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S

customer_reviews.title: Laser Rocket Axe
customer_reviews.text: This axe is a laser. I love it. I use it mainly for oak. I have their IsoCore maul, too, and it's good for the nastiest oak, but this x27 is just so much easier for generating the a in our little F=ma friend. I have swung it thousands of times, hitting the dirt plenty, and it has held its original edge the entire time. You won't be disappointed with this axe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars x27 does the job
customer_reviews.text: As with the others reviewers - I really like this axe. Does not appear to be that sharp on arrival. Decided to not edge with a file and try as is. Light, balanced and yes you can swing this hard without the "lift" of my 8lb (or your heavier) maul. Bottom line, great for splitting good size logs BUT keep your 8lb maul handy too! One size does not fit all! 4 stars because after a few days of splitting 12-18 rounds of red oak, counted at least 8 burs. Not steel savvy or expert but that is troubling and NOTHING but wood contacted the blade.
customer_reviews.author: RAM Leather

customer_reviews.title: Best Splitting Axe
customer_reviews.text: The longer 27" handle lets you easily split logs up to 10 inches in diameter. Most folks aren't chopping down trees, but this would easily do the task. The blade is razor sharp, but you'll need to put an edge back on it after a hard day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed Friskars products and own many great tools from their company. I have had this axe on my wishlist for almost a year now and finally treated myself. I just used it for the first time to chop down an overgrown lilac shrub. It is lightweight and very sharp. I got the job done in no time. I really like the enclosure piece that protects the blade when not in use. A great tool to have for wood cutting or light garden jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip O.

customer_reviews.title: Best log splitting axe I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I see I bought this three years ago. I just used it again last night. This is the best log splitting axe I have ever used. I've had used traditional axes, mauls, wedge and sledge, but this axe blows through everything and is very comfortable. I'm not sore or that tired after splitting for a couple hours. I don't have to bring a collection of tools to split wood. I just bring this axe. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: reedbr

customer_reviews.title: Great axe for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on reviews and it lives up to them! Best axe for the money I’ve ever used. Cons- handle material sucks and isn’t ergonomic, prefer wood but over all cost and quality take over. Lot of negative reviews with broken heads, I’m sure casting QC has some off days as with any product, mine is good I even went through a round I was splitting and hit a big ass rock, it chipped the blade a bit but over all not bad considering and angle of head still cuts fine
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Can do the heavy and precision splitting work
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient splitting tool. I bought this so I could make more precise splits after using my 8lb maul for the heavy work. What I found was this ace worked better than my maul for the heavy splits, too. Sharp edge leads the charge but the beveled bald head really creates a great split. Large splits or small, it’s fantastic. Effortless to swing and it splits with just the slightest stroke. Best wood splitting purchase I have made, yet.
customer_reviews.author: BigGuy94

customer_reviews.title: Amazing..
customer_reviews.text: "Wow" for an axe like this, its worth the money. This thing chops through wood almost like butter. I've seen people with bigger axes and sweating their tail off,not this. I've chopped a quarter of wood without my work clothes on just getting out of the car in no time. Just think, I said "I would never swing an axe." A Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Raafi

customer_reviews.title: Who needs a gym?
customer_reviews.text: I had a pretty large hardwood that a neighbor gave me a few pieces of. I got this axe as a Black Friday/Cyber Monday deal for $30, cant complain about that price! On top of that, this thing is fantastic and made splitting a breeze, in addition to giving me a nice workout. Im 5'8" and about 140 lbs, and this thing is just the right fit. Ive even used it to shave kindling to start fires. Its worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SleepingKnight

customer_reviews.title: Split wood like a lumberjack with this!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best axe I’ve used in my life. I can split firewood and kindling with one swing almost every time. My old regular axe is not going to get much use anymore. The design of this head splits wood when my regular axe gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective for its light weight
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight head and handle makes this easy to use. Very sharp and thin leading edge flares to a wide cross-section. Can split up to about a foot in diameter; bigger than that usually needs a splitting wedge. They tell you not to hit the back end of the head with a sledge hammer and they mean it -- mine started to crack after a hundred hits or so. Don't use it as a splitting wedge. Weighs under 6 pounds. Haven't used my old 8-pounder since I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Recycler

customer_reviews.title: Almost too easy...
customer_reviews.text: I’ll admit I was skeptical about the hollow handle, but damn if this isn’t one of the best axes I’ve swung. The weight is only where you need it, and not where you don’t. And the handle really does all but eliminate that shock of a dud swing. The angle of the wedge is just right for general splitting: not too aggressive, but more than enough to make the vast majority of pieces a one-swing job. I’ll be interested to see how the bit and the neck hold up after some use, but initial impressions are very positive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. The weight is evenly distributed, and lightweight, and splits well! No complaints! We are also short, 5'3" and 5'6", and it's perfect for us! Not worried about swinging it down and chopping your shins.
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeSauce

customer_reviews.title: Really nice axe but still difficult to split hard wood.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to split quite a bit of wood with this axe and I really like the balance, the grip and the action. It splits most woods but on the really hard stuff it takes a lot of force and sometimes still won't split it. But for most of what I have, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: What a Beast!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fiskars X27 mainly because of the favorable reviews. I needed to replace my 6 lb. splitting maul. When it came the its light weight was a concern. Boy was I wrong! This solid beast has split 7 cords of Maple, Oak and Beech with ease!!. I'm sold on it. The one piece handle and head are a big selling point. The handle is solid and I can't see it ever breaking!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Top-Shelf Quality Splitting Axe
customer_reviews.text: There's NOTHING to dislike about this axe. It's the absolute PERFECT splitting axe. If there's a better axe, I've never seen one. I split hard, wet wood quickly and easily. The axe doesn't get stuck. Something to do with the design of the head. It splits so easily on dry wood, it's like splitting butter. I recommend the big one and I recommend this axe to anyone that needs a top-shelf quality splitting axe.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas F.

customer_reviews.title: Not Entirely Effective Against BigFoot!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and a matching Fiskars X7 Hatchet when my wife & I moved to a house in the California High Desert that has a wood stove, thinking that I'd be chopping a lot of firewood. As it turned out, we bought cords of firewood that didn't need chopping, so I never used either of 'em, they just gathered dust in the garage. We've since moved back to the Low Desert and no longer have a wood stove. So I sent both the axe & the hatchet to an ol' buddy of mine in Homer up in Alaska. He loves 'em and says that they're a joy to use, and he should know...
customer_reviews.author: Darrin-in-HB

customer_reviews.title: Splits awesome. Solid. Odd weight balance. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Odd balance for anyone used to a hickory handle. Pretty light for the whack provded.. I’d say it splits as well as my 8lb maul on smaller rounds but not on big stuff. I switch back and forth depending on the size of rounds. Great for not worrying about the head coming loose, or damaging handle with mistrikes. Has survived my 14yo son learning to split — with no apparent damage.
customer_reviews.author: 4kdoyle

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, easy splitting
customer_reviews.text: Seems very thin where handle wraps around the head interested to see long term durability, Very Very sharp barley grazed the top of my hand while walking with it and needed 7 stitches. The coating has almost totally worn off after 1 season of wood (3-4) cord. Splits very nicely with almost no effort; way better than swing a maul all day. Still nearly as sharp as new
customer_reviews.author: Keven

customer_reviews.title: A solid axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a tried and true axe, a standard in the industry. You can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Atwell

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.  Makes splitting a lot easier.
customer_reviews.text: Been splitting a lit of firewood with this. It works very well. I bought a Fiskars 8lb maul for the larger rounds and that does very well too. I am very happy with this tool. The head itself is softer than most quality axes go and will dull after some use, as well as it may get a few nicks in the edge as well. The Fiskars 120740 x-sharp sharpenner is a very useful must with this axe. Unfortunately, the sharpener is not yet sold in the US. Had to order from a UK seller on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Tops!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best splitter I've ever used. Grew up with furnace that required 9 cords split and stacked as a teen. I'm now 30and wish I'd have had this then. I was so impressed with this, I set up the flood light to finish the splitting. I originally purchased the x7 hatchet which also is amazing. This will be the brand I buy for the rest of my days
customer_reviews.author: lance

customer_reviews.title: Splits cherry and oak rounds very well!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I am relatively new to splitting large amounts of wood. However, this has been far superior to my other axe. I am amazed at how light and ergonomic it is. I'm 5ft 5" and this axe fits me fine. When splitting big rounds (around 20+ inches) I've found that cherry is easy, oak is a little tougher but not bad, and hickory is very tough. I've tried many techniques, but even this highly rated axe isn't going to easily split a knotted round of hickory. It's best to take off parts around the outside working towards the center. Overall this thing has been a big help and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: While it lasted it split wood beautifully. Second day in the head snapped off.
customer_reviews.author: MFMc

customer_reviews.title: YOU...will...love...these...axes
customer_reviews.text: I...LOVE...these...axes. I already owned the X15, which convinced me to purchase this and the X7 hatchet. They are not cheap...but in no regard. Truly a case of you get what you pay for. These are hard, edge-holding steel wood cutters AXES. These people evidently have a little experience and know-how. I love the heft, balance, design, grip and impressive durability. Sometimes woodcutting/splitting can be a chore. These tend to make me just keep going! I would recommend or buy another of these in a heartbeat. I also believe I won't have to. I think I can also stop looking for another...unless I see they come out with a double-bitted version. :)
customer_reviews.author: PHILLIP

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: First of all, package arrived as promised. Friendly delivery person. Axe is very nice and has good weight distribution. I let my neighbor borrow it and he also liked it. We have just gotten started getting ready for winter and I am glad that I have this axe. It is heavy enough to be effective but not so much weight that you get worn out quickly. I am thinking about buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: mamaseoul

customer_reviews.title: Literally the perfect splitting axe
customer_reviews.text: Literally the perfect splitting axe. I am only 5' 11" and I'm super unclear why folks think you have to be Andre the Giant to operate this bad motor scooter. Step back a few inches, find your range and you are a wood killing machine. I tested it on the worst target I could find, green bull pine sections that were 2 1/2 feet in length. My maul bounced off, the X27 (who thinks of these names?) bit immediately and a couple swings later the green logs inexplicably split perfectly. As a former SERE instructor, I don't say this often about woodcraft devices, but holy crap - this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Great warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this axe in 2012. We’ve used it each year since then with no issues other routine maintenance until this year when the head snapped off upon impact with a log. Anyway, I’m writing this review all these years later because I am so impressed with the warranty. Fiskars stands behind their product. The online form was user friendly and we received the replacement in a timely manner. I would definitely purchase Fiskars products again!
customer_reviews.author: Bowsar78

customer_reviews.title: Does the work
customer_reviews.text: The length of handle give this axe more power and comfort. I simply rise the axe over my head and control the fall while focusing on the target. You can split wood all day. The blade seems to take a beating and pits a lot . maybe the steel could be better
customer_reviews.author: Vonclyde

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It's a little pricey, but i enjoy using this axe. It came with the hatchet, and i also enjoy using that. I split about two full cords of wood with the axe. It's still super sharp and no issues with the handle durability. I fear if the handle does break, then the head will be useless, but i haven't run into that issue yet.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph s

customer_reviews.title: works really good
customer_reviews.text: this works great !! Swings well, nice and sharp. splitting oak with two hits. I suggest any newcomers to wood splitting remember a few simple tips. 1. safety first 2. have a hard object underneath the wood being split (dont bother doing it on dirt) 3. aim for close to edge of log (not middle) 4. take advantage of natural cracks already in the wood enjoy your workout and a great fire !
customer_reviews.author: David M. Cadieux

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! They aren't lying when they say
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! They aren't lying when they say, "one-strike splits." This thing is an animal and doesn't require much force to do the job. I HIGHLY recommend YouTubing the efficient way to split wood instead of the traditional way - grouping many logs together and then binding them with rope, cable, chain, etc. vs. placing a single log on top of another and repeatedly bending over to reset the logs once they're split. With the efficient method and this axe, you can knock out a ridiculous amount of firewood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stays sharp , comfortable handle.
customer_reviews.text: Best axe I have ever used. Stays sharp. Comfortable handle. The 36” length is perfect. High quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Man

customer_reviews.title: so I have split some logs a lot lately and had a great Axe before that broke
customer_reviews.text: OK...so I have split some logs a lot lately and had a great Axe before that broke. I haven't gotten around to replacing the handle on it but iit works great as a wedge to get my current Axe unstuck. Then I purchased this fiskars x27.......WOW I'm extremely impressed. I own three other axes but nothing compares to this Axe. I will see how long it holds up but the feel, durability, and functionality iis unreal. Very smooth and hardly need power to split logs. I split elm and ash tonight that's wet from the rain and my fiskars Axe never hesitated slicing right through them...love this product and will never purchase another Axe besides fiskars!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: leanne k

customer_reviews.title: Well made and useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I use it often while bringing in wood for the winter. It holds its edge well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Philip Copitch

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works great
customer_reviews.text: It is slightly heavier than expected, but still easy to grip and use for chopping wood!
customer_reviews.author: Mason Grey

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for four years now and can't say enough good things about it. It's longer than a regular splitting axe, and the handle is a strong and non slippery composite material so it's very safe, and it works incredibly well. I get a chord of wood delivered every year and it makes it almost a pleasure to split the needed pieces of wood. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: mickeyc

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully, is well balanced
customer_reviews.text: To me Fiskars stands for high quality and these are no exception. When I first received it I did not think it was going to be very efficient at splitting the oak and mesquite I use for firewood. Seemed to me that the head was somewhat on the smallish side. Wrong again! Works wonderfully, is well balanced, and doesn't seem to have as many "glancing blows" as some of the heavier splitters I've tried. If you have not already done so please use Amazon Smile as your default page for shopping here and I would greatly appreciate your designating Wheat Cutter Foundation as your charity.
customer_reviews.author: tctopcat

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Easy to Manage, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Common sense not included. Apparently, I was lacking some common sense and I’ve never chopped wood before. However, I’ve learned the ways of being a mountain man and I can now embark on finding a wife.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Splits like a knife in butter
customer_reviews.text: This splitting axe is the bees knees! I don't have much experience with others, however all the forums and reviews I read said this is the best in it's price range! And I have had no issues so far. My edge is also still very sharp with no knicks or anything like others have complained about. It's splitting my "rock maple" like butter. The 36 inch handle takes a little getting used to though. I'm 5 10 200lbs and I may have able to get away with the x25 instead. No regrets though!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Head is chipped.
customer_reviews.text: The ax head came with a big chip in it. Very dissatisfied. It
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than the rest
customer_reviews.text: I've been going through maul like crazy. Keep busting the heads off because I sometimes miss hit and land under the head on the handle. They are toothpicks compared to this bad boy. I love the fact that it came with a plastic head guard for when it's not being used. I like that since it's possible to ding the blade when moving it around and out of the way in the garage. The unique design of the head attached to the handle is very impressive. I still continue to miss hit when chopping wood, but this axe is super forgiving and can handle a lot of abuse. Great product and I highly recommend this to anyonr.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Faulds

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it. My spine is shot. I still use wood to heat- this helps with the occasional split
customer_reviews.text: This axe is well designed IMHO. It's like a small wedge (not a 18lb sucker), sharp, great handle, right length- you can knock apart logs with this thing. I was really surprised as I've always used the big iron and this thing is effective. Great in the back of an SUV, truck, or at home. I just love it and I like the sheath , too. Well worth it and it was more $ at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Cosgringo

customer_reviews.title: Good durable blade and comfortable handle
customer_reviews.text: Good design, the cutting edge is a tiny bit more blunt than desired but it’s very durable and still cuts good with a bit more effort, light and doesn’t rust, the handle could use some padding but doesn’t need it, feels great with gloves, ok without
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great look, feel, and function... Until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I have an email into fiskars and am guessing they'll replace it but I can't figure this out... On their website: Virtually Unbreakable With stronger-than-steel FiberComp handles and inseparable insert-molded heads, our axes don’t just outlast others they’re virtually impossible to break. ...So maybe I should enter a strong man contest!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Grandson says it's a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my young grandson who has taken up splitting firewood for his families fireplace. He loves to be outdoors working. He had been using a "standard" old fashioned axe and pretty much wore the wood handle out at the head (pretty common for beginners). I found this Fiskar's axe and after watching a few YouTube videos, ordered it for him. First time he tried it, he wasn't too impressed, but did say the piece he was splitting had a knot in it. After further use, he said it works very well. He said fine tuning the edge with the Fiskar's blade sharpener I gave him with it really made a positive difference. He really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: semi-retired

customer_reviews.title: Would for sure recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’m not an expert at using this tool. With that being said, it’s very well balanced and extremely comfortable to use and execute correct and solid splits. I love it, I don’t think I ever need another. It’s comfortable and performs great.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Boy

customer_reviews.title: A butter knife for logs
customer_reviews.text: This axe has shown me I've been under viel of lies my entire wood cutting life. I've been able to split logs with huge knots hiding within them like nothing. I can cut branches in pieces unlike ever before. The sturdy handle with fantastic length has given me untapped potential to fly through logs. It's almost too easy, I'm losing the ability to get a good workout in splitting. Needless to say, you'll want this axe to tackle those chores that were once an actual 'chore' and turn them into a fun time. I cannot believe I wasted so much energy and time using big box store-bought inferior axes. Shame on me... thank you Fiskars!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, very sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This ase is awesome. I haven't had a lot of wood splitting experience, but after 10 minutes I really got going. It is super sharp, if you drop it on the edge of a cardboard box it will go right through! Use caution. I really liked that the sharpener was included as well. Vibration dampening seems pretty decent, but I really don't have much to compare it to. Check out Buckin' Billy Ray's "flip" technique (where you find most videos) as it was VERY helpful.
customer_reviews.author: skyrunr

customer_reviews.title: If you use an axe, get this!
customer_reviews.text: I've used many other axes before and this one is hands down the best. My 14 year old son has also been using it for the past two years and is able to split logs easily with it. You'll want to make sure you have something to sharpen it. My son has some glancing blows sometimes and if the axe hits the ground, it's going to get dull very fast. I wish the edge where your bottom hand holds on wasn't quite so sharp. Sometimes, my hand slips down a bit further and it hurts when I hit the log. Something that some athletic tape will likely fix.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Great product after several cords of wood splitting
customer_reviews.text: The lighter weight, angle of the head, and the sharp blade make this an awesome wood splitter. I started splitting wood this year with my felling ax and it was fine. There was some knoty hemlock I could not split. I bought this and after two strokes they were split. It makes me look way better than I am. Very good product. The edge has chipped a bit after being burried in the ground a few times. It has not affected ease of splitting.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Splits like a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! Used it today to bust of some willow that I just dropped "live" about 2 weeks ago. Busted them up pretty easy. Way better than any other "maul" that I have ever used. This looks more like an axe, but splits like a beast! Like how light it is. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: I have to say using this ax is very easy to chop and split wood
customer_reviews.text: I am not as experience as some people at chopping wood. I have to say using this ax is very easy to chop and split wood. I am chopping and splitting wood at least 10 inches in diameter. I found out i should be letting the wood dry out before cutting it some it will be easier to chop ; but this ax is still cutting through hard and not dried wood like a champ. i will be up loading some videos later to chow.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Donald

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE ax head broke off while in use
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing splitting ax until the head broke off only two months after purchase, mid-swing. Terrifying. The handle and attachment to the blade is nothing more than hollow plastic/fiberglass, and apparently quite flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Eck

customer_reviews.title: Good axe
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time yesterday and, being the first time I split wood by hand, found the axe to be relatively easy to handle. It took me a few swings to get the feel for it but once I did, went pretty easy. For some of the smaller pieces (approx. 6" or so in diameter) did not require a full swing to split it out. Only time will tell how it will work over the next months, etc. but, overall feels pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: rwilzb001

customer_reviews.title: Get a Sledgehammer and a Wedge Instead
customer_reviews.text: Edge is chipped after the first time using it (against about 20 maple no wider than 12" diameter); I didn't strike any nails or anything -- just wood. At a certain point I stopped using the edge and just started using the butt with an, and that was WAY more efficient. I should have just gotten that wedge and a sledgehammer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Young

customer_reviews.title: Can splitting wood be fun?
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy getting outside and splitting wood with my Fiskars X27 Super Splitting ax. I upgraded from a heavy splitting maul which provided a ton of weight, but failed to equal the slighter Fiskar X27. The lighter weight of the X27 also gives you more control with your follow-through to allow you to dial in the size of split which i enjoy since i'm trying to split thinner chunks for burning hotter in my maple sap evaporator. Great light weight splitting ax that is worth a strong look if you need a new ax.
customer_reviews.author: Belson524

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn’t like a big axe?
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn’t like a big axe? Whoever said bigger wasn't better was either lying to themselves or someone else. In all seriousness the axe made short work of a rather large pile of wood. My husband put the handle to the test in short order when he missed the log his was trying to split and hit it with the handle instead. My husband is a big man, 6’6” and 300 lbs and the handle stood up to his abuse.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Like Butter
customer_reviews.text: Was banking on a friend with a splitter to help clean up some applewood on my property. I got sick of waiting for him and picked up one of these axes. Applewood is like cutting string cheese made of steel cable for those of you who never have had to split it. This thing was absolutely amazing. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes to hand split their own firewood.
customer_reviews.author: The Bookster

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it and while you wait for delivery watch a few of the online videos. Then join me and have a warm winter.
customer_reviews.text: I had never split logs in my life before moving to the country. Our first full-time Winter and we needed wood for our fireplace. I acquired a cord of wood which needed to be split in order to fit our fireplace. Tried an regular axe with little success except to frustrate myself. I then went to the internet and read reviews. Long story short, I selected and ordered the Fiskars X27. Watched a few videos online and went to work. After the normal beginner trials all went well. This Axe is magic. It makes the job easier and I think safer. I am 6'2" and think the longer handle makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford Lavine

customer_reviews.title: Ax me for a review
customer_reviews.text: Chop chop chop and that’s what I love about this ax. I needed to chop down a tree in my backyard to make way for my new lemon tree and this ax cut the tree down very easily. This was my first time using an ax and I did not come across any problems.
customer_reviews.author: PlAyEd-YoU

customer_reviews.title: This thing knocks it out of the park!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly light weight, one swing and this thing cuts through logs like a sharp knife through butter. It takes very little effort to split logs, let the tool do the work. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M Valero

customer_reviews.title: Just average
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading articles and rave reviews that this is the best splitter to be found. I have to say I disagree. There is absolutely nothing in particular that I can find wrong with it but I see nothing special about it either. It works just the same as the 20 year old and the 5 year old ones that I use.
customer_reviews.author: jones

product_meta.title: Fiskars 378841-1002 X27 Super (36") Splitting Axe
product_meta.description: Style:AxeIdeal for taller users or anyone who prefers a longer axe, Fiskars much-requested X27 Splitting Axe provides power that makes splitting medium-sized to extra-large logs easier than ever. Like every X-Series Hatchet or Axe, the X27 combines perfected weight distribution, advanced blade geometry, an ultra-sharp edge and virtually unbreakable design to maximize your performance. This combination of features allows the blade to disperse wood more effectively, offering more one-strike splits with each swing. It also includes Fiskars longest handle for increased leverage to maximize the power and speed of taller users. Since you can split wood more easily with the X27, each job requires less time, less effort and less hand strain.
feature_bullets: Ideal for taller users splitting medium- to large-sized logs
Designed for maximum efficiency to give you more one-strike splits. Textured non-slip grip reduces hand strain and improves control
Perfected balance and power-to-weight ratio increases swing speed to multiply power, much like an aluminum baseball bat
Advanced bevel convex blade geometry adds power and makes the blade easier to remove from wood

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,572 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
